meanings.sent1: The antitoxic medicine helped neutralize the poison in his body.
meanings.sent2: The antitoxic serum was effective in counteracting the venom of the snake.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her cooking was so antitoxic, it could cure any food poisoning.
meanings.sent4: His kindness acted as an antitoxic shield against the negativity around him.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's suit was like an antitoxic armor, protecting him from all harm.

meanings.definition: A substance that counteracts or neutralizes toxins.
meanings.sent1: The doctor administered the antitoxic to counteract the effects of the venom.
meanings.sent2: She always carried an antitoxic in her first aid kit for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The antitoxic was so powerful that it could neutralize even the deadliest poisons.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against toxins, the antitoxic emerged as the ultimate weapon.
meanings.sent5: The antitoxic acted like a guardian angel, protecting the body from harmful substances.
